title: How to Make a Fast and Simple Pie Crust

steps.headline: Cool all ingredients beforehand to prevent gluten in the flour from activating.
steps.description: The two variables that influence gluten activation are time and temperature, so keep both to a minimum.

steps.headline: Cut in the shortening with a pastry cutter.
steps.description: If you do not have one, pull two knives in opposite directions to cut the shortening. Continue until the shortening is the size of small peas and coated with flour.

steps.headline: Add the water a little bit at a time and stir until it comes together in a ball.
Can be used right away, but is best after being refrigerated for about 4 hours, no longer than overnight.

text: Cool all ingredients beforehand to prevent gluten in the flour from activating. The two variables that influence gluten activation are time and temperature, so keep both to a minimum. Mix flour and salt.  Cut in the shortening with a pastry cutter. If you do not have one, pull two knives in opposite directions to cut the shortening. Continue until the shortening is the size of small peas and coated with flour. Add the water a little bit at a time and stir until it comes together in a ball.  Can be used right away, but is best after being refrigerated for about 4 hours, no longer than overnight.  Finished.
